sermons.title: Gideon #1: The Presence Of The Lord
sermons.description: Ed Miller introduces the life of Gideon as what it means to be a channel through which the Deliverer will deliver.  The burden of Ed's heart for this series is how to press into the presence of the Lord, the only hope for blessing.  (This series of messages was delivered at the 2002 Del-Mar-Va Men's Retreat in Easton, MD.)

sermons.title: Gideon #2: The Preeminence Of the Lord Jesus Christ
sermons.description: What is the preliminary process in becoming a blessing to others?  Christ must become not one of many prominent things (even good things like missions, ministry, family, local church) but preeminent--the one and only.  And if you do, like Gideon, expect all kinds of opposition, as you become identified with Christ outside the camp and receive a new name: "Baal fighter".

sermons.title: Prepared for the Snare
sermons.description: Gideon was a man used by God to vanquish the oppression of the enemy in his people's lives. Gideon got off to a great start with the Lord. But he had a hellish finish. God needs some people whom he can use who want to go all the way with him but they must stay small, dependent on God in their own sight and never touch his glory. A warning against getting your eyes on the church, or the leadership, rather than God. To God alone be the glory, not flesh.

sermons.title: When Defeat Becomes Doctrine
sermons.description: Great message! If there were really revival in America, people would be walking in Victory over sin. "Defeat" has become doctrine in far too many churches. This is another powerful rebuke toward "false" Christianity. A "must hear" for any Christian.
